蜲蜲蜲

蜲字的基本解释

蜲
wēi
〔蜲蜲蜿蜿〕盘曲蜿蜒而动的样子，如“振鳞奋翼，蜲蜲蜲蜲。”

蜲字的汉语字典释义

[①]［wēi］
［《廣韻》於爲切，平支，影。］
(1)见“蜲蛇”。
(2)见“蜲娜”。
[②]［wěi］
［《廣韻》於詭切，上紙，影。］
见“蜲2”。

蜲字的康熙字典解释

【申集中】【虫字部】　蜲； 康熙笔画：14； 页码：页1087第19
【集韻】鄔毀切，音委。【類篇】蟲名，蜲?也。詳蛜字註。　又【唐韻古音】於爲切，音萎。蜲蛇，與委蛇同。【傅毅·舞賦】蜲蛇姌嫋。【柳宗元·天對】有虬蜲蛇，不角不鱗。　又【類篇】同蟡。詳蟡字註。

蜲字的源字形

字形对比：

中国大陆宋体台湾细明体香港明体日本明朝体韩国明朝体旧字形
蜲字的起名意思

暂无。

Basic explanation of words
Stupid
wēi
〔Centennials meandering】A snaking and winding appearance, such as "strike the scales and lift the wings, centipedes and centipedes."
Stupid
Chinese dictionary definition of words
[①]［wēi］
["Guangyun" Yu Weiqi, flat branch, shadow. ]
(1) See "Snake".
(2) See "Minna".
[②]［wěi］
["Guangyun" in a sly cut, on paper, shadow. ]
See "蜲2".

Kangxi dictionary interpretation of words
[Shenzhen Collection] [Insect Character Department] 　蜲; Kangxi Strokes: 14; Page Number: Page 1087 Page 19
【Ji Yun】Wu Ruiqi, music committee. [Classes] Insect name, scorpion? Detailed note of the word.　[Tang Yun ancient sound] Yu Weiqi, the sound faded. The worm snake is the same as the Wei snake. 【Fu Yi·Dancing Fu】The snake is curled up. [Liu Zongyuan·Sky Pair] There are horned snakes, without horns or scales.　[Classes] Same as 蟡. Detailed note of the word 蟡.
